author: silvia.ecclesia
title: Climathon: Blockchain4Climate
description: Blockchain for climate action requires multi-disciplinary collaboration across communities: co-creation processes could enhance innovative solutions leveraging blockchain's transparency.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal misses the main objective of the challenge which is to reduce tribalism and increase collaboration/interoperability among chains. The proposer intends to organize a blockchain-related challenge at the Climathon event in Geneva. However, the proposal fails to define how it specifically intends to foster collaboration with other chains or even which chains it intends to coordinate with. some kind of partnership or even a roadmap to create a partnership with other chains which are interested in the topic of climate action (which there are plenty out there) would align this proposal with the objectives of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has the relevant skills and experience to organize such a program. Although they have not written enough information about the team's skills/experiences, it can be found on the website of the event's main organizer (Impact hub). From the website and information available elsewhere online it is evident that the organization has a long-standing experience in organizing similar programs. The event has been implemented before and is already planned well and will be carried out in November, so the implementation of the event is almost certain. Even though the budget may seem small, when considering that the majority of the event's planning/organization is carried out by Impact Hub, some of the budgeted items seem confusing. For instance, the budget allocated for recruitment and communication seem excessive for a program that intends to have an estimated 10 participants. more details on items of relatively larger allocation will go a long way in getting a more positive assesment.
f6_assessments.q2: As the event is already in the organization process, the timeline and roadmap of the program are clear and reasonable. The event's organization has several well-established channels of communication and is more than adequate to update the community on the implementation of the program. The outcomes of the program are also clearly stated and clear and understandable KPIs

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal somewhat addresses the challenge, however it doesn't appear to have cross-collaboration as it's goal, just to participate in a blockchain for climate hackathon. 

The idea is strong and I like how the proposers are introducing Cardano to a broader audience, however, there is no indication whether the end result would in fact support cross chain collaboration. Instead, teams may have no incentive to work together and collaborate across chains as they will be competing in the hackathon, which might pit them against each other, including their respective chains. 

One thing I would encourage the proposers to do is to engage members of the community who are already directly working on blockchain and climate solutions, such as Cardano4Climate. As a well established group in the community C4C could potentially help navigate this space and provide a group of willing participants to engage and identify solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the experience and plan presented it is somewhat likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully. 

The team plans to "lobby" the climatathon 2022 event in order to include a blockchain specific challenge. What is not abundantly clear through the proposal is the likelihood that such an challenge would be researched, developed, promoted, and adopted with enough time to spare before the event itself. Given that the team doesn't appear to have the expertise in house (at least not from the information provided). To this end, I think the team could have explained their expertise in working with blockchains. 

The budget also leaves a bit to be desired with not a lot of details on how the money will be spent for each activity. It is not that a line by line description is needed but rather there are some clear activities at each stage listed. Regardless, the budget is very modest and likely is low-risk to the community.
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes, the information provided is sufficient to audit hte progress and success of the proposal. 

The team has a clear goal: host a blockchain specific challenge at the next Geneva Climatathon in November 2022. This is easy for the community to confirm. 

The KPIs and other success measures are well laid out and mostly focus on the attendance and success of the challenge itself, including the amount of participants, number of solutions developed, and number of people reached through outreach. I think picking two innovative solutions is a good threshold and realistic. 

The one reason why I feel I can't give full marks here is that there is a significant risk that the end goal would not be implemented due to the research not being adequate, disinterest from the organizers, or myriad other reasons. Given that the project could not take off in the first place, there is little way for the community to whether there would be anything to audit at all. 

Regardless, kudos to the team for a great idea. I would encourage you to address some of the concerns listed herein should you submit again.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your assessment! We understand we should have been more clear about how we see our proposal addressing the challenge. By bringing a blockchain-related challenge to Climathon we will raise awareness on Cardano, Catalyst and other chains among participants (students, researchers, employees of Geneva-based NGOs and IOs) and encourage them to learn about their use for Climate. We are already in contact with Climate Neutral Cardano and Cardano Foundation to involve them as speakers, experts and presenting their use cases (e.g. Veratree)

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement does not identify a problem, such as this: "The advancement of tackling issues related to climate change with people from various communities is lacking." or something similar. The statement given is, itself, a solutions statement. Though the problem it appears to solve (and this is where the issue is, we can only guess at what the real problem is, if rewriting, please define it as such), which is written in quotes above, seems to fit in line nicely with the Challenge.

This creative way of pulling together communities is an excellent value-add for Cardano. Further, it isn't so much focused on financial growth as a central theme but rather a more profound concern that most of humanity shares: Climate change. And as it relates to this Challenge: How can we collaborate cross-chain to impact climate change in measurable ways? 

A potentially weak mitigation tactic solves the risk of finding new participants. A more concrete tactic could look like this: "we will reach out to unpaid people who might help us, we hope..." These rationales support the 4 star score
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a well-detailed plan for a proposal such as this. The details are offered in a fully dated roadmap and a list of main deliverables and outputs. Voters can be fully aware of where the project plans to be at any given time and what actionable tasks they will be taking. As someone who's sat on several planning committees for such events (though non-blockchain related in my own experiences), the timetable for such an event does appear reasonable.

The budget is clear, though not broken down sufficiently. Voters, and the Catalyst community at large, deserve our best attempts at transparency. Hourly/daily/per project rates should all be included. Further, areas such as "communication" and "recruitment" deserve to have full explanations in dollar terms. If rewriting, please focus on adding several more details to the otherwise decent budget. Adding a 5%-10% contingency budget is standard; please add if rewriting.

The skills of both team members are offered. It is clear that, in total, between them both, they have the necessary skills to carry out the plan written in this proposal. They are a large part of the team, and we all benefit from more participation directly with Catalyst. An organizer of Climathon Geneva and a research assistant from IHG for startups are the right people for the work. If rewriting, please encourage all participants to add their ideascale account to the proposal.

There are no resources outside of those explained needed for the project. This section receives 4 stars for this section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap and milestones offered in the previous section are more than adequate and clear for creating such an event. The proposal's author has a clear idea of their plan, and voters can be sure it has been well thought out. That, along with the previous experiences in these conversations and events, means the team is working from experience. Participants will benefit from their time spent working with participants in these conversations. 

The metrics include doing make sense for determining some amount of success. However, the proposer would also benefit from tracking other outcomes. One might be tracking the number of participant-created Catalyst proposals inspired by the gathering, another the number of participants' opinions in a brief survey.

There is no mechanism at present for the community to track success. Adding a monthly vlog or a Gitbook account to follow where the team is from week to week would be a welcome addition for voters.

f6_assessments.q0:
Proposal is about creating blockchain-related challenge inside Climathon, a hackaton focused on climate change issues that takes place in Geneva. Idea makes a lot of sense as this topic is has been growing in imporance more and more needs to a multidisciplinary approach to be solved. The use of blockchain can help this in many fronts, but first, awareness need to be raised both about blockchain and about climate change. This is a good opportunity not only for raising this awareness but also for having possible concrete solutions as an output. As the proposal focus on blockchain as whole, with Cardano co-operaintg with other chains, there's a good challenge fit here, aiming kpis as "Number of events / workshops / sessions arranged with other communities" and "Number of permanent initiatives with cross-chain teams ".

Proposal also ellaborates well on how climathon works and what the value propositions for key stakeholders are. It could though, explain with more details on how proposers intends to engage the parties and different teams, form different chains, to participate in it. it could have more details on how the follow up with winning teams will be done afterwards. These information are essential to understand how the ecosystem will be motivated and whether solutions will be successful, brining real impact for climate and blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding timeline, the one for this project is divided into 5 months with good activities in it. I liked that communication and marketing is considered, this is key for the project. it could just be more broken down into smaller tasks associated with it to evaluate how this will help. The same comment stands for "Preparation laboratory with participantss" activity. It could also be explained how the winners will be chosen.

Budget breakdown matches the plan but some lines are a bit vague. For example, what costs are included in "Recruitment" or "Facilitation"?.

The team is composed of 2 people already committed and involved in climathon. However, it could be better explained what connections they have with blockchain or worked done/experience in this field. For this project to work,a good network of contacts is essential. Linkedin links could also be provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
The elements provided for auditing this project seem fair. There are good kpis in place and milestones can be extracted from timeline. I particularly liked the metric of "# of people reached by communication of the solutions afterwards", measuring this will certainly help to understand the impact of it.
I'd also consider issuing a report at the end of the project with the main learnings and findings, explaning the methodology used here.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks funding for the development of a blockchain related challenge on the theme of transperancy at Climathon Geneva.
The problem is vaguely explained, however we could deduce that the problem is the lack of popoularity of the blockchain as a platform for transperancy.
Climathon being an international all inclusive platform or innovation with a climate solution focus means that a challenge like this will be a platform for all blockchains to participate. This is in line with the challenge goals and metrics.
The impact will be mainly in the awareness and understanding section of this challenge.
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer considers the risk of lack of participants in the challenge, however the proposer hopes that Climathon is a significant event with many participants to supply the people needed. There is no other mitigation for this risk presented.
This is a single event and the plan for this proposal is straight forward, however more detail will be beneficial. The plan presents a concise list of deliverables, which makes a good impression and will help for the auditability of the proposal.
The plan presents a budget with unsuficient detail. There are no work hours or hourly wages, there are just expenses for category.
The proposer presents the team by name and positions, however the rpoposer fails to provide CVs attached or linkedin profiles for support and further research.
This proposer has 4 proposals in fund 9 for a total ask of $128500
The proposer will eventually return to Catalyst for funding of another challenge.
I neither agree nor disagree that the project plans and budget supplied is feasible to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer presents a list of KPIs for the auditability of this project, however fails to mention concrete numbers against which the community can compare.
The proposal has well described success metrics with concrete numbers for comparison.
 I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

solution: Proposing a blockchain challenge on the theme of transparency at Climathon Geneva: annual open-innovation event to co-create for and commit to climate action, hosted at Impact Hubs globally.
experience: Impact Hub has more than fifteen years of experience in community building with a focus on sustainability and circular economy. Since 2019, we have been hosting Climathon Geneva, an annual event taking place at Impact Hubs across the world, to support the Cantonal Climate Plan.
